about.description: The package polyhedral_gravity provides a simple-to-use interface for evaluating the full gravity tensor of a constant-density polyhedron at arbitrary given computation points according to the geodetic convention. The computation is based on the line integral approach by Tsoulis et al., which transforms the triple integral into a summation. The implementation relies on a fast, parallelized backbone in C++ capable of evaluating the gravity at thousands of computation points in a fraction of a second. The package includes the functionality to read a polyhedral mesh from files and transform it to fulfill the preconditions of Tsoulis' formulation.
about.summary: Package to compute full gravity tensor of a given constant density polyhedron for arbitrary points according to the geodetic convention

name: polyhedral-gravity-model

about.description: The package polyhedral_gravity provides a simple-to-use interface for evaluating the full gravity tensor of a constant-density polyhedron at arbitrary given computation points according to the geodetic convention. The computation is based on the line integral approach by Tsoulis et al., which transforms the triple integral into a summation. The implementation relies on a fast, parallelized backbone in C++ capable of evaluating the gravity at thousands of computation points in a fraction of a second. The package includes the functionality to read a polyhedral mesh from files and transform it to fulfill the preconditions of Tsoulis' formulation.
about.summary: Package to compute full gravity tensor of a given constant density polyhedron for arbitrary points according to the geodetic convention

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "polyhedral-gravity-model" %}
{% set org = "esa" %}
{% set version = "3.1.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/{{ org }}/{{ name }}/archive/refs/tags/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: d411087c45b431e10ed64f2bc9a6c932e988584f299f2a5b67737e3776e36ef2

build:
  script_env:
    - CMAKE_GENERATOR=Ninja
    - POLYHEDRAL_GRAVITY_PARALLELIZATION=OMP
    - BUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON
    - _LIBCPP_DISABLE_AVAILABILITY=1  # [osx]
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv
  number: 0

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}
    - cmake
    - make  # [linux]
    - ninja
    - llvm-openmp  # [osx]
    - libgomp  # [linux]
  host:
    - python
    - spdlog
    - xsimd >=11.0.0
    - thrust
    - pybind11
    - pip
  run:
    - python

test:
  imports:
    - polyhedral_gravity
  requires:
    - pip
  commands:
    - pip check

about:
  home: https://github.com/esa/polyhedral-gravity-model
  summary: Package to compute full gravity tensor of a given constant density polyhedron for arbitrary points according to the geodetic convention
  description: >
    The package polyhedral_gravity provides a simple-to-use interface for evaluating the full gravity tensor of a constant-density polyhedron at arbitrary given computation points according to the geodetic convention. The computation is based on the line integral approach by Tsoulis et al., which transforms the triple integral
    into a summation. The implementation relies on a fast, parallelized backbone in C++ capable of evaluating the gravity at thousands of computation points in a fraction of a second. The package includes the functionality to read a polyhedral mesh from files and transform it to fulfill the preconditions of Tsoulis' formulation.
  license: GPL-3.0-only AND AGPL-3.0-or-later
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - LICENSE
    - TetGen_LICENSE
  doc_url: https://esa.github.io/polyhedral-gravity-model/
  dev_url: https://github.com/esa/polyhedral-gravity-model

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - schuhmaj
    - gomezzz
    - darioizzo

about.description: The package polyhedral_gravity provides a simple-to-use interface for evaluating the full gravity tensor of a constant-density polyhedron at arbitrary given computation points according to the geodetic convention. The computation is based on the line integral approach by Tsoulis et al., which transforms the triple integral into a summation. The implementation relies on a fast, parallelized backbone in C++ capable of evaluating the gravity at thousands of computation points in a fraction of a second. The package includes the functionality to read a polyhedral mesh from files and transform it to fulfill the preconditions of Tsoulis' formulation.
about.summary: Package to compute full gravity tensor of a given constant density polyhedron for arbitrary points according to the geodetic convention
